intro: Eugenioides hohenackeri, commonly known as the Hohenacker's eugenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and glossy, elliptical leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
